intro: Chamaesyce vallis-mortae, commonly known as the rock purslane, is a low-growing annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, arid environments and is often found in disturbed soils. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss in dry conditions. Chamaesyce vallis-mortae is typically found in coastal areas and is well adapted to coastal climates.
